conclusion: To find the position of the particle on the x-axis at \( t = 8 \, \text{s} \), we need to calculate the displacement using the area under the velocity-time graph.
Velocity increases linearly from \( 0 \) to \( 2 \, \text{m/s} \) from \( 0 \) to \( 1 \, \text{s} \).
Area of triangle from \( 0 \) to \( 1 \, \text{s} \) is \( 1 \, \text{m} \).
Velocity is constant at \( 2 \, \text{m/s} \) from \( 1 \) to \( 3 \, \text{s} \).
Area of rectangle from \( 1 \) to \( 3 \, \text{s} \) is \( 4 \, \text{m} \).
Velocity decreases linearly from \( 2 \) to \( 0 \, \text{m/s} \) from \( 3 \) to \( 4 \, \text{s} \).
Area of triangle from \( 3 \) to \( 4 \, \text{s} \) is \( 1 \, \text{m} \).
Velocity decreases linearly from \( 0 \) to \(-1 \, \text{m/s} \) from \( 4 \) to \( 6 \, \text{s} \).
Area of triangle from \( 4 \) to \( 6 \, \text{s} \) is \(-1 \, \text{m} \).
Velocity is constant at \(-1 \, \text{m/s} \) from \( 6 \) to \( 7 \, \text{s} \).
Area of rectangle from \( 6 \) to \( 7 \, \text{s} \) is \(-1 \, \text{m} \).
Velocity increases linearly from \(-1 \) to \( 0 \, \text{m/s} \) from \( 7 \) to \( 8 \, \text{s} \).
